intro: Grona caffra, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange or yellow tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Grona caffra thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
